p.shortTitle: The Remittances Of Foreign Exchange And Investment In Foreign Exchangebonds (Immunities And Exemptions) Act, 1991

formula.name: EnactingText
formula.p: BE it enacted by Parliament in the Forty- second Year of the

longTitle.p: An Act to provide for certain immunities to persons receiving remittances in foregin exchange and to persons owning the Foreign
Exchange Bonds and for certain exemptions from direct taxes in relation to such remittances and bonds and for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto.
WHEREAS the position relation to balance of payments has become difficult and it is necessary to attract large inflow of foreign exchange;

With a view to attracting such inflow of foreign exchange, it is expedient to provide for certain immunities and exemptions to render it possible for certain persons to receive the said remittances in foreign exchange and to own the said Bonds;

content.p: PRELIMINARY
This Act may be called the
Remittances of Foreign Exchange and Investment in Foreign Exchange
Bonds (Immunities and Exemptions) Act, 1991.
It extends to the whole of India.
CHAP

REMITTANCES OF FOREIGN EXCHANGE

section.heading: Definitions. In this Chapter, unless the context otherwise requires,--

item.p: " recipient" means a person as defined in clause (31) of section 2 of the Income- tax Act, 1961 (43 of 1961.) who receives any remittance under this Chapter;
" remittance" means remittance made in foreign exchange by any person resident outside India to a person resident in

Explanation.-- For the purposes of this clause," specified date" means the 1st day of December, 1991 or such other later date as the Central Government may, by notification in the

item.p: all other words and expressions used in this Chapter but not defined and defined in the Foreign Exchange Regulation Act,

section.heading: (46 of 1973.) shall have the meanings respectively assigned to them in that Act.

blockList.listIntroduction: Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force,--

item.p: no recipient, who claims immunity under this Chapter in accordance with such scheme as the Reserve Bank of India may, by notification in the Official Gazette, specify for the purposes of receiving remittances under this Chapter, shall be required to disclose, for any purpose whatsoever, the nature and source of the remittance made to him;
no inquiry or investigation shall be commenced against the recipient under any such law on the ground that he has received such remittance;

the fact that the recipient has received a remittance shall not be taken into account and shall be inadmissible as evidence in any proceedings relating to any offence or the imposition of any penalty under any such law.

section.heading: Remittances not to be taken into account in certain cases.
